knowledge_items.content: Epic: A large body of work that can be broken down into a number of smaller tasks, or stories
Feature: A distinguishable aspect of a system that fulfills a requirement and contributes to an Epic
Technical Dependencies: The requirement for a feature to function depends on the existence or functioning of another feature
Non-functional Requirements: Aspects of the system that do not perform a specific function but define the system's behavior
Features should always support the epic's overall goals
Clearly articulate the boundaries and scope for each feature
Avoid defining features that are not independently valuable

knowledge_items.description: Epics must have defined validation rules
Non-functional Requirements must have specific validation rules

knowledge_items.content: Edge Cases: Considering scenarios that occur only at extreme operating parameters

knowledge_items.description: Edge cases must be considered in the knowledge map
Each validation rule must be related to a test case

knowledge_items.content: Validation Rule and Test Case Relation: Each validation rule must be linked to a test case to support proper verification
Test Case and Knowledge Item Relation: Each test case must be linked to a validation rule in a Knowledge Item to ensure accurate testing

knowledge_items.description: Test cases must have defined validation rules

knowledge_items.content: Validation Rule and Test Case Relation: Each test case must be linked to a validation rule to support proper verification

validation_rules.description: Features must be independently valuable and deliverable
Features must have a clearly defined scope and boundaries
Features must have a clear estimation and priortization
Features must always support the epic's overall goals
Features should account for non-functional requirements
